Description:
Subscribe on your fav podcast app: https://www.vscodepodcast.com/subscribe

In this episode of the VS Code Insiders podcast, James sits down with Julia to explore the fast-changing world of AI models inside VS Code. They dive into how developers can evaluate models, the role of fine-tuning, and why speed versus complexity matters. From Raptor Mini to Sonnet, this conversation reveals the behind-the-scenes work shaping your coding experience today.

Raptor Mini: https://github.blog/changelog/2025-11-10-raptor-mini-is-rolling-out-in-public-preview-for-github-copilot/

Chapters: 00:00 Welcome & introductions 00:51 Diving into models and evaluations 02:25 Choosing models: gut feel vs. science 04:47 Why models feel different week to week 07:17 Fine-tuning explained & checkpoints 09:49 The story behind Raptor Mini 12:21 When to use mini vs. larger models 15:12 Context, complexity, and developer workflows 16:47 Understanding evaluations (evals) 19:35 Benchmarks & VS Codeâ€™s own eval suite 21:15 How developers can give feedback 23:34 Closing thoughts & subscribe reminder
